pages.text: Networks in Kevlar allow you to transfer stuff long distances without the need for long wires or pipes in between your components.

In general terms, a network has transmitter blocks and receiver blocks. A network also has a range, so if you try to transfer something from a transmitter to a receiver and they are further than this limit away, then you need a booster within range of each of them. In this way, you create a network of transmitters, receivers and boosters.
To avoid signal interference, each type of network has 16 different colors. Right click on any of the network-related block with a dye to change its color.
